<p class="mw-empty-elt"><p>The <b>hooded merganser</b> (<i><b>Lophodytes cucullatus</b></i>) is a species of fish-eating duck in the subfamily Anatinae. It is the only extant species in the genus <i><b>Lophodytes</b></i>. The genus name derives from the Greek language: <i>lophos</i> meaning 'crest', and <i>dutes</i> meaning 'diver'.
